criteria: Accuracy of identifying colonial powers and their respective territories in the specified regions (Africa, Southeast Asia, China, India, Latin America, and the Philippines).
Depth of discussion regarding the motivations and methods of colonial rule by the identified nations.
Clarity and organization of presentation. (This includes the quality of writing, logical flow of information, and use of supporting evidence.)
descriptions: Demonstrates no understanding of colonial powers or their territories.
Identifies only one or two colonial powers with significant inaccuracies regarding their territories.
Identifies some colonial powers but struggles to accurately match them to their respective territories; several inaccuracies present.
Identifies most of the major colonial powers and their territories with some minor inaccuracies or omissions.
Accurately identifies nearly all colonial powers and their territories within the specified regions, with only very minor errors.
Comprehensively and accurately identifies all colonial powers and their territories within the specified regions, demonstrating a strong understanding of colonial rule.
Provides no discussion or understanding of the motivations or methods of colonial rule.
Offers a superficial or irrelevant discussion of colonial motivations or methods.
Attempts to discuss motivations or methods of colonial rule but demonstrates a limited or incomplete understanding.
Provides a basic discussion of the motivations and methods of colonial rule, but lacks depth or specific examples.
Discusses the motivations and methods of colonial rule with reasonable depth and provides some specific examples.
Offers a comprehensive and insightful discussion of the motivations and methods of colonial rule, supported by specific and relevant examples, demonstrating a nuanced understanding.
Presentation is unclear, disorganized, and lacks logical flow. Writing is difficult to understand.
Presentation is somewhat disorganized and lacks clarity in several areas. Writing contains errors that impede understanding.
Presentation has some organization but may lack clarity in places. Writing contains some errors.
Presentation is generally clear and organized with a logical flow of information. Writing is mostly clear with few errors.
Presentation is clear, well-organized, and demonstrates a logical flow of information. Writing is clear and concise with minimal errors.
Presentation is exceptionally clear, well-organized, and presents information in a compelling and logical manner. Writing is polished and error-free.
